papers.title: Socialization in Open Source Software Projects: A Growth Mixture Modeling Approach

papers.title: The Onion Model: How Successful Open Source Projects Handle Newcomers

papers.title: Joining Free/Open Source Software Communities: An Analysis of Newbies' First Interactions on Project Mailing Lists
papers.relevance: Shows how initial interactions with core developers predict successful integration and promotion within OSS teams

papers.title: The Evolution of Initial Core Team Members in Open Source Projects
papers.relevance: Documents how core teams expand through mentorship and promotion pathways in successful OSS projects

citations.reasoning: Multiple studies document how mentorship and socialization processes create reinforcing cycles of team growth in OSS communities.

papers.title: Community-Based Learning: The Core of Open Source

papers.title: The Paradox of Open Source: The Tension Between Coding and Community Management
